thread.title: Singer Who Performed at Inauguration ‘Disappointed’ by Trump Rollback of Transgender Student Rules
thread.title_full: Singer Who Performed at Inauguration ‘Disappointed’ by Trump Rollback of Transgender Student Rules

author: Josh Feldman
title: Singer Who Performed at Inauguration ‘Disappointed’ by Trump Rollback of Transgender Student Rules
text:
Singer Who Performed at Inauguration ‘Disappointed’ by Trump Rollback of Transgender Student Rules by Josh Feldman | 8:35 pm, February 22nd, 2017 
Jackie Evancho performed the National Anthem at President Trump ‘s inauguration and tonight she tweeted her disappointment after news that his administration is rolling back Obama-era rules designed to protect transgender students . 
Evancho’s sister Juliet is transgender and her family has been very public about supporting her . 
Evancho posted a message to Twitter expressing her disappointment with the president and her hope that he will meet with her and her sister: I am obviously disappointed in the @POTUS decision to send the #transgender bathroom issue to the states to decide. #sisterlove 
— jackie evancho (@jackieevancho) February 22, 2017 . @realDonaldTrump u gave me the honor 2 sing at your inauguration. Pls give me & my sis the honor 2 meet with u 2 talk #transgender rghts ❤ 
— jackie evancho (@jackieevancho) February 23, 2017 
[ image via screengrab ]
